page.title: 02TONMAWR - AN OUTLINE HISTORY
page.content: Tonmawr was built to house the colliers who worked in any of half a dozen drift mines in the immediate area. Drifts -or{levels- were started by a number of independent capitalists who moved into the area. In one or two cases, local farmers started drift mines on their land. Local sandstone was quarried out for building. The problem of getting the coal out of the valley was solved by building railways. The main coal carrying line ran from{Abercregan}via Tonmawr, down to{Briton Ferry.}The most ambitious railway development is credited to a capitalist called{Parson {but as this}enterprise broke him financially, a bridge in the area -now demolished- that was built by him is called Parson's Folly ... a name sometimes given to the whole Parson railway.
